title: More evidence of charge on sphere

content.question: Some students observe that a hollow metal sphere hanging on an insulating string is attracted to a positively charged rod. They decide that this is evidence that the sphere could also be charged. The answer to which of the following questions might determine whether they are correct?

choices.label: Is the sphere still attracted when the positively charged rod is placed on the other side of the sphere?
Is the sphere repelled by a negatively charged rod?
Is the attraction of the sphere to the rod weaker when the distance between them is increased?
Is the attraction of the sphere to the rod stronger when the charge on the rod is doubled?

content.answer: Is the sphere repelled by a negatively charged rod?

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
